experiment: F-PHI1: Instability of nothing across substrates
question: How can there be something from nothing?
method: Cross-substrate structural analysis: test 'nothing' in 6 substrates (physics, mathematics, biology, computation, information theory, philosophy) for whether true nothing exists or is merely minimal structure

results.real_question: Why does minimal structure amplify into complex structure?

iso_connections.ISO-4: CANONICAL — minimal states at critical thresholds, perturbation cascades
iso_connections.ISO-5: CANONICAL — positive feedback amplifies first structure
iso_connections.ISO-6: STRUCTURAL — low-entropy initial states are unstable (inverted application)
iso_connections.ISO-7: CANONICAL — complex macro from simple micro, irreducible
iso_connections.ISO-14: CANONICAL — amplification repeats at every scale
iso_connections.ISO-18_candidate: STRENGTHENED — symmetry (nothing-like) is unstable, asymmetry (something-like) is attractor

swarm_parallel: CORE v0.1 was never nothing — it was minimum viable seed (protocol + substrate + energy) containing rules for own expansion
rule: Nothing is the name for the minimum that already contains the rules for its own expansion
